column5: drawing his gun and immediately shooting Tom Cruise in the head. “I thought I told Evy not to put me down for mummification
column6: ” he mutters as he looks at his surroundings. He is inexplicably not decomposed or mummified

column9: I’ll have to start at the beginning. Then they just replay the entirety of ‘The Mummy’ (1999). After credits scene: Young Hot Blonde™: That still doesn’t explain how you ended up alive in a sarcophagus in the year 2017. Brendan Frasier: Oh

column1: earthtojuli 161030446297 "2017-05-24 19:40:24 GMT" https://earthtojuli.tumblr.com/post/161030446297/helorific-one-thing-that-makes-me-happy-about "helorific: One thing that makes me happy about Brooklyn Nine-Nine (even in light of this stressful finale) is that peraltiago relationship conflict is mostly external. Like
column2: I feel like most shows depict unhealthy romantic relationships with internal conflict
column3: in which characters fight and lie to each other and break up and make up over and over again. For some reason
column4: a lot of writers seem to think that internal conflict is the only way to add drama to an established relationship. But Brooklyn Nine-Nine? After the initial will-they-won’t-they dramatics
column5: Jake and Amy are nothing but supportive of each other at every step in their relationship. Jake doesn’t resent Amy for being ambitious. Amy doesn’t resent Jake for being a hot mess. They communicate with each other. They affirm each other. The most relationship conflict we’ve seen is when they get separated by external circumstances (Florida and now prison
column6: apparently). tl;dr: I wish more writers would realize that you can write interesting romantic pairings without relying on unhealthy relationship tropes. " False text

column1: earthtojuli 161058514917 "2017-05-25 14:31:24 GMT" https://earthtojuli.tumblr.com/post/161058514917/general-election-2017-quarter-of-a-million "ailedhoo: evilelitest2:  news-queue:  A last minute surge in people registering to vote has seen a quarter of a million young people under 25 years old sign up on the last possible day before the general election. Cabinet Office figures show that a total of 622
column2: 000 people registered to vote on 22 May
column3: of which 246
column4: 000 were under 25.  Young people were dominant among those registering
column7: 000 people over the age of 65.  Anyone who registers to vote after 22 May will not be eligible to vote in the general election on 8 June. The 620
column8: 000 figure is up from an average of about 100
column9: 000 a day throughout the last week
column11: 000 a day since the general election was called in April. The figures should only be treated as indicative because there is no easy way to check whether you are registered to vote
column12: meaning some people who signed up may have already been registered.  Young people are also far more likely to live in private rented accommodation and thus have to move house frequently
column13: which would require them to re-register. As well as the surge on Monday
column15: 000 people in total applied on Sunday
column16: with a similar age split. The statistics could be good news for Labour
column17: which is far more popular among young people than it is among older people. The spike comes after a huge voter registration drive that saw social networks including Facebook and Snapchat encourage their users to register to vote. Musicians ranging from Pink Floyd frontman David Gilmour to grime artist JME also urged people to register. One scheme offered voters free Grime concert tickets if they signed up.  Kenny Imafidon
column18: of the Bite The Ballot campaign said: “In the past week alone we have seen over half a million under 24 year olds apply to register to vote.”  Read More  Holy shit. seriously if these people go out and vote it could save the day @ailedhoo  To all folk who registered in the UK… Please
column19: for the love of all… GET OUT TO VOTE ON POLLING DAY! Together we can make June the end of May! " False link

column1: earthtojuli 160877226347 "2017-05-20 16:33:32 GMT" https://earthtojuli.tumblr.com/post/160877226347/cbs-comedy-mom-is-trading-emmy-campaigning-for "prochoiceamerica: seandotpolitics: As Emmy nominations draw near
column2: one network comedy has made the almost unheard of decision not to campaign—not because it doesn’t stand a chance
column3: but because it can think of something more useful to do with its money. Mom earned two back-to-back supporting actress wins for one of its central stars
column4: Allison Janney—in 2014 and 2015. (She was nominated in 2016
column5: but lost out to Saturday Night Live’s Kate McKinnon.) But this year
column6: rather than throw down cash for yet another campaign for gold statuettes
column7: CBS will donate the budgeted funds to Planned Parenthood. As the Republicans continue to work toward pushing through their replacement for the Affordable Care Act
column8: Janney and Mom co-creator/executive producer Chuck Lorre have decided to raise awareness around the threats that specifically target Planned Parenthood
column9: Variety reports. (The version of the American Health Care Act that passed in the House includes a provision that would slash funding for the organization.) They’ll appear on CBS This Morning as part of their special Mom campaign
column10: encouraging their fans to donate to the organization. (Vanity Fair has reached out to Janney
column13: and will update this post accordingly.) Although the move to forego campaigning is extremely rare
column14: such decisions could become more mainstream over the next few years. As Variety notes
column15: United Talent Agency canceled its 2017 Oscars party in protest of Donald Trump
column17: 000 to the A.C.L.U. and the humanitarian organization International Rescue Committee.    They’ve already won the Emmy for “best comedy series” in our hearts." False link

column1: earthtojuli 160806933527 "2017-05-18 16:24:40 GMT" https://earthtojuli.tumblr.com/post/160806933527/congress-just-gave-trump-awful-news-about-his-next "machine-dove:  Rep. Ted Lieu (D-CA) has formally introduced a bill into Congress that would require Trump to reimburse the government for funds spent on travel to his own properties
column2: such as Mar-a-Lago in Florida and the Trump National Golf Club in Bedminster
column3: NJ. Lieu’s bill
column4: the Stop Waste and Misuse by the President (SWAMP) Act
column5: states that Trump’s travel “results in the American taxpayer effectively subsidizing the president’s businesses.” The bill would also require that Trump reimburse the government for Secret Service costs derived from visits to his properties.  " False link

column1: earthtojuli 160563078852 "2017-05-11 21:53:11 GMT" https://earthtojuli.tumblr.com/post/160563078852/finally-an-actor-with-autism-is-starring-in-this "fuckyeahgreatplays: When actor Mickey Rowe found out he had been cast as the leading character in “Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time
column2: ” the news brought tears to his eyes. Earning a spot in a production of the Tony Award–winning play based on Mark Haddon’s 2003 murder-mystery novel of the same name was a life-changing accomplishment in itself. But even more remarkably
column3: Rowe was cast in the role of Christopher
column4: a 15-year-old with autism spectrum disorder. Having been diagnosed with autism at age 21
column5: Rowe is one of the first actors with autism to play a character with autism on a major professional stage ― and the very first to play Christopher in the critically-acclaimed show set to premiere this fall at the Indiana Repertory Theatre before traveling to New York’s Syracuse Stage
column6: an achievement the Broadway production was never able to pull off. …   In an email to HuffPost
column7: Rowe explained how living with autism not only prepared him for his role as Christopher
column8: but his life as an actor. “Autistics use scripts every day
column9: ” he wrote. “We use scripting for daily situations that we can predict the outcome of
column10: and stick to those scripts. My job as an autistic is to make you believe that I am coming up with words on the spot
column12: the first time the conversation has ever happened in my life; this is also my job on stage as an actor.”   " False link

column4: who’d have thunk?  More money flowing means more money flowing. Surprising.  Economically
column5: the most useless people are the ones who have money and won’t spend it
column6: not the ones who don’t have it and MUST spend it.  reblogging again for that last important fact  This is one of those articles where I want to be like “water is fucking wet” but I know there are so many people who will not acknowledge this shit until they hear it from the people they’ve been trained to trust by capitalism.  So it’s entirely a necessary article. It really is. There’s a huge audience for whom these kinds of articles are necessary. It’s good to have them
column7: and to spread them. The writers were right to write it and the publishers right to publish it. Information is power
column8: and having more easy and accessible stories like this from people that broad audiences find immediately trustworthy or authoritative.  But also WATER IS FUCKING WET. " False link

column1: earthtojuli 159436887492 "2017-04-11 02:20:06 GMT" https://earthtojuli.tumblr.com/post/159436887492/authorities-reportedly-detaining-and-killing-gay "sullengirlalmlghty: sullengirlalmlghty:   More than 100 gay men have been detained “in connection with their nontraditional sexual orientation
column2: or suspicion of such
column3: ” according to the New York Times
column4: which cites the opposition newspaper Novaya Gazeta. The Russian newspaper says it confirmed the news with government officials and an analyst of the region also confirmed the news to the Times with her own sources. Three men are known to have been murdered
column5: although the real number is likely to be higher.  in almost every genocide
column6: the first “act” is the rounding up and killing of a group of men
column7: specifically.  In “root and branch” genocides they [”civilian men of ‘battle age’”] are often the first group to be separated out and massacred
column8: paving the way for the murder of women
column10: and elderly men. In more common articulations of genocide
column12: they can be the only group slated for outright massacre
column15: and elderly men suffer a range of alternative fates involving rape
column20: and expulsion. Gender and the Future of Genocide Studies and Prevention   as the rest of this article explains this isn’t to say that men have it worst in a genocide
column21: but that it’s important when you see a very common red flag for genocide to pay attention to the “conflict” in case any more markers of an impending genocide occur.  the g word is really loaded and i’m not bringing this up because i want to start an avalanche of “CHECHNYA IS COMMITTING GENOCIDE AGAINST GAY PEOPLE” fear mongering (that is the absolute last thing that i want). it’s just not possible to prevent any genocide without questioning whether a current conflict might eventually get there. and i do not think it’s nothing that genocide watch is reporting on this.  UPDATE 4/10/17 Chechnya has opened concentration camps for gay men   Gay men arrested in a ‘purge’ in the Russian region of Chechnya are being held in concentration camp-style prisons
column22: reports have alleged. Early reports emerged earlier this month that gay people are being targeted in the region
column23: which is part of Russia but has substantial autonomy. Russian newspapers and human rights groups report that more than 100 gay men have been detained “in connection with their non-traditional sexual orientation
column24: or suspicion of such” as part of a purge. Several people were also reportedly feared dead following violent raids. In a chilling response
column25: a Chechen government spokesperson denied that there are any gay people to detain
column26: insisting that “you can’t detain and harass someone who doesn’t exist in the republic”. The Kremlin denied any knowledge of a purge. But reports have since emerged that the men arrested are being kept in horrific concentration camp prisons
column27: where violent abuse and torture is common. Based on interviews with eyewitnesses and survivors
column28: Novaya Gazeta reports that a secret prison has been set up in the town of Argun to detain the men arrested in the purge. One man who was released from the camp told the newspaper that he was subjected to violent “interrogations” at the camp
column29: as Chechen officials attempted to get him to confess the names and locations of more gay men. The officials also seized his mobile phone
column30: targeting his network of contacts regardless of whether they were gay or not. The camp was reportedly set up by Chechen forces in a former military headquarters in the town. The newspaper reports allegations that the Speaker of the Parliament of Chechnya was among officials to visit the site
column31: though the claims have not been substantiated. The detainees face electric shock torture and violent beatings
column32: while some of them have been held to ransom and used to extort their families. Tanya Lokshina of Human Rights Watch wrote: “For several weeks now
column33: a brutal campaign against LGBT people has been sweeping through Chechnya. She continued: “Law enforcement and security agency officials under control of the ruthless head of the Chechen Republic
column35: have rounded up dozens of men on suspicion of being gay
column36: torturing and humiliating the victims. “Some of the men have forcibly disappeared. Others were returned to their families barely alive from beatings. At least three men apparently have died since this brutal campaign began.” She added: “These days
column37: very few people in Chechnya dare speak to human rights monitors or journalists even anonymously because the climate of fear is overwhelming and people have been largely intimidated into silence. “Filing an official complaint against local security officials is extremely dangerous
column38: as retaliation by local authorities is practically inevitable. “It is difficult to overstate just how vulnerable LGBT people are in Chechnya
column39: where homophobia is intense and rampant. “LGBT people are in danger not only of persecution by the authorities but also of falling victim to ‘honour killings’ by their own relatives for tarnishing family honour.” What Can We Do?   Alexander Artmyev from Amnesty International spoke to Metro.co.uk. He said that people who are not in Russia can help by joining the charity’s Urgent Action on Chechnya. The action encourages people to write in Russian or your own language to Chairman of the Investigation Committee and Acting Head of the Investigation Committee for the Chechen Republic. Amnesty has also asked the letter
column40: which should ask for an investigation and appeal for protection for LGBT individuals
column41: to be copied into Human Rights groups and diplomatic missions from your country. " False link

column1: earthtojuli 159001990242 "2017-03-30 14:31:33 GMT" https://earthtojuli.tumblr.com/post/159001990242/dreamers-post-on-paying-taxes-goes-viral "justinspoliticalcorner: Kaila White at The Arizona Republic
column2: via USA Today:   PHOENIX — On Sunday morning
column3: Arizona State University junior Belen Sisa posted a simple Facebook update that she paid her taxes. By Sunday night
column4: dozens of strangers were messaging her that she is a criminal and a liar
column5: and that they reported her to be deported. Sisa
column7: is a “dreamer” — her parents visited the U.S. from Argentina when she was 6 and overstayed their visas — but she is shielded from deportation by President Obama’s Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program. DACA allows young undocumented immigrants without serious criminal records who were brought to the U.S. as children to register their personal information with the government
column8: and in exchange receive federal work permits and a two-year reprieve from the threat of deportation
column9: which allows them to get a Social Security number and a driver’s license. “I was hoping to kind of make a statement and educate people. What you’ve known all this time isn’t the truth
column10: ” Sisa said Monday morning. Speaking out for dreamers Sisa is an outspoken advocate for dreamers: In 2015 she wrote a popular opinion piece pressing Arizona leaders to grant in-state tuition to dreamers. Last year she served as a page at the Democratic National Convention
column11: even though she can’t vote. “I decided to post it basically to bust the myth that immigrants don’t contribute and they don’t pay taxes to this country
column12: ” she said.  She said she filed state and federal taxes and
column14: paid $300 to the state. She publicly posted a photo of herself holding a Form 1040 along with this caption: “MYTH BUSTER: I
column16: just filed my taxes and PAID $300 to the state of Arizona. I cannot receive financial aid from the state or federal government for school
column19: or a retirement fund. I think I’m a pretty good citizen. Oh and there are MILLIONS just like me who pay into a system they will never receive anything from. Wanna tell me again how I should be deported
column20: contribute nothing and only leech off this country while the 1% wealthiest people in this country steal from you everyday? How about you show me yours Donald J. Trump? #HereToStay” […] More on immigration and taxes Although the issues of tax contributions and economic impact of immigrants without legal status are complicated
column21: some non-partisan organizations have worked to analyze the matter. The 11 million undocumented immigrants living in the United States in 2013 collectively paid an estimated $11.64 billion a year in state and local taxes
column24: according to a report last year from the Institute on Taxation and Economic Policy. “The best evidence suggests that at least 50 percent of undocumented immigrant households currently file income tax returns using Individual Tax Identification Numbers (ITINs)
column25: and many who do not file income tax returns still have taxes deducted from their paychecks
column27: the chief actuary of the Social Security Administration
column28: told The Atlantic a similar number last year: He said undocumented immigrants paid $13 billion into Social Security in 2010
column29: and only received about $1 billion in benefits.    Belén Sisa’s now-famous Facebook post on undocumented immigrants and taxes is right on the money. Her story also dispels the myth that undocumented immigrants don’t pay taxes in this nation.Also
column30: they pay far more into taxes than they will ever receive from it.   " False link

earthtojuli 157146973917 "2017-02-12 15:12:10 GMT" https://earthtojuli.tumblr.com/post/157146973917/end-of-fillings-in-sight-as-scientists-find "thebibliosphere: nikoladrawsstuff:  ineffablewitch:  docwithtardisfez:  whenthemusicsended:  venerabledreadnought:  thinksquad:  Researchers at King’s College London found that the drug Tideglusib stimulates the stem cells contained in the pulp of teeth so that they generate new dentine – the mineralised material under the enamel. Teeth already have the capability of regenerating dentine if the pulp inside the tooth becomes exposed through a trauma or infection
column2: but can only naturally make a very thin layer
column3: and not enough to fill the deep cavities caused by tooth decay.  But Tideglusib switches off an enzyme called GSK-3 which prevents dentine from carrying on forming.  Scientists showed it is possible to soak a small biodegradable sponge with the drug and insert it into a cavity
column4: where it triggers the growth of dentine and repairs the damage within six weeks.  The tiny sponges are made out of collagen so they melt away over time
column5: leaving only the repaired tooth.  That is by far the coolest thing I’ve heard this year.  WHAT.  Me and my 11 cavities are paying attention.  please god let this become a thing quickly  @thebibliosphere  I require this to be a thing immediately so I don’t lose any more teeth. fuckin sign me up to be experimented on. " False link

earthtojuli 156585025867 "2017-01-30 16:22:54 GMT" https://earthtojuli.tumblr.com/post/156585025867/time-to-pull-out-again-the-14-points-of-fascism "angry-old-asian-man:  thewatermelonmag:  The 14 points of Fascism  Powerful and Continuing Nationalism Fascist regimes tend to make constant use of patriotic mottos
column2: slogans
column3: symbols
column4: songs
column5: and other paraphernalia. Flags are seen everywhere
column6: as are flag symbols on clothing and in public displays.  Disdain for the Recognition of Human Rights Because of fear of enemies and the need for security
column7: the people in fascist regimes are persuaded that human rights can be ignored in certain cases because of “need.” The people tend to look the other way or even approve of torture
column11: etc.  Identification of Enemies/Scapegoats as a Unifying Cause The people are rallied into a unifying patriotic frenzy over the need to eliminate a perceived common threat or foe: racial
column12: ethnic or religious minorities; liberals; communists; socialists
column14: etc.  Supremacy of the Military Even when there are widespread domestic problems
column15: the military is given a disproportionate amount of government funding
column16: and the domestic agenda is neglected. Soldiers and military service are glamorized.  Rampant Sexism The governments of fascist nations tend to be almost exclusively male-dominated. Under fascist regimes
column17: traditional gender roles are made more rigid. Opposition to abortion is high
column18: as is homophobia and anti-gay legislation and national policy.  Controlled Mass Media Sometimes the media is directly controlled by the government
column20: the media is indirectly controlled by government regulation
column21: or sympathetic media spokespeople and executives. Censorship
column23: is very common.  Obsession with National Security Fear is used as a motivational tool by the government over the masses.  Religion and Government are Intertwined Governments in fascist nations tend to use the most common religion in the nation as a tool to manipulate public opinion. Religious rhetoric and terminology is common from government leaders
column24: even when the major tenets of the religion are diametrically opposed to the government’s policies or actions.  Corporate Power is Protected The industrial and business aristocracy of a fascist nation often are the ones who put the government leaders into power
column25: creating a mutually beneficial business/government relationship and power elite.  Labor Power is Suppressed Because the organizing power of labor is the only real threat to a fascist government
column26: labor unions are either eliminated entirely
column27: or are severely suppressed.  Disdain for Intellectuals and the Arts Fascist nations tend to promote and tolerate open hostility to higher education
column28: and academia. It is not uncommon for professors and other academics to be censored or even arrested. Free expression in the arts is openly attacked
column29: and governments often refuse to fund the arts.  Obsession with Crime and Punishment Under fascist regimes
column30: the police are given almost limitless power to enforce laws. The people are often willing to overlook police abuses and even forego civil liberties in the name of patriotism. There is often a national police force with virtually unlimited power in fascist nations.  Rampant Cronyism and Corruption Fascist regimes almost always are governed by groups of friends and associates who appoint each other to government positions and use governmental power and authority to protect their friends from accountability. It is not uncommon in fascist regimes for national resources and even treasures to be appropriated or even outright stolen by government leaders.  Fraudulent Elections Sometimes elections in fascist nations are a complete sham. Other times elections are manipulated by smear campaigns against or even assassination of opposition candidates
column31: use of legislation to control voting numbers or political district boundaries
column32: and manipulation of the media. Fascist nations also typically use their judiciaries to manipulate or control elections.  Do a mental survey here. " False link
